intro: Achyronia prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate achyronia, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It typically thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed areas. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in landscaping for erosion control.
